1115635598528786438.text: @rustlang is the most-loved language in the StackOverflow survey for the 4th year in a row. 83.5% of current users would like to continue using it -- higher than any previous years.https://insights.stackoverflow.com/survey/2019#technology-_-most-loved-dreaded-and-wanted-languages …

1121828910646419457.text: Latest #rustlang video, about "representing types in rustc". This video is part of an experiment. The compiler team's learning WG will try to turn it into a rustc-guide chapter for others to read!https://youtu.be/c01TsOsr3-c

1119197163999911936.text: New #rustlang blog post: "AiC: Adventures in consensus". Exploring what it might mean to "focus on finding the best solution, rather than winning the argument". http://smallcultfollowing.com/babysteps/blog/2019/04/19/aic-adventures-in-consensus/ …

1112105097029402624.text: Really enjoyed @withoutboats's talk on futures at @RustLatamConf. I like how it put the current solution in the full historical context, and framed past failings in terms of zero cost abstraction violations.
